description: Erection of single storey rear extension (5.0m in depth, maximum height of 3.8m and eaves height of 2.8m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extension would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

With regards to Condition 6 (Boundary Treatments) the applicant has submitted plan showing a brick wall to the frontage which would result in harm to the root system of the Sycamore which is to be retained as per the approved permission. In order for officers to satisfactorily discharge Condition 6 with the proposed changes, the applicant is required to submit an updated Arboricultural Method Statement to demonstrate that the chosen boundary treatment would not harm the root system of the tree, as well as detailing how this will be achieved and overseen by the appointed arboricultural consultant.
